video_settings_h.help1Txt: This is where settings for the equipment connected to the video
video_settings_h.help3Txt: on the Axis product are made.
video_settings_h.help10Txt1: Color level - Select an appropriate level by entering a value in the range 0-100. Lower values mean less color saturation, while the value 100 gives maximum color saturation.
video_settings_h.help10Txt2: Brightness - The image brightness can be adjusted in the range 0-100, where a higher value produces a brighter image.
video_settings_h.help10Txt3: Contrast - Adjust the image's contrast by raising or lowering the value in this field.
video_settings_h.localContrTxt: Local contrast - Applies contrast to a specific area of the image. Use the slidebar to adjust the image's contrast, where a higher value produces an image with high contrast between dark and light areas.
video_settings_h.sharpnessTxt: Sharpness - Controls the amount of sharpening applied to the image. In general, a higher setting will improve the image's sharpness, but at the expense of increased image noise, especially in low light conditions. There may also be image artifacts present around areas with high contrast (e.g. sharp edges). A lower setting reduces the amount of image noise, but makes the image less sharp.
video_settings_h.help5Txt: Physical connector - Set the connection type for the video source.
video_settings_h.help55Txt: Auto - The product first checks the BNC and then the tele plug connector for a video signal. It will keep checking until it finds a signal from one of the connectors
video_settings_h.helpbncTxt: BNC (composite video) - Connects a standard video camera or other video equipment
video_settings_h.helptelpubTxt: Tele plug - 2.5 mm connector for covert camera
video_settings_h.help11Txt: BNC (composite video) - connects a standard video camera or other video equipment
video_settings_h.help12Txt: Y/C (S-video) - connects an S-video camera or other video equipment,
video_settings_h.cable_Txt: which requires a Y/C to BNC cable - please refer to the user's manual.
video_settings_h.help8aTxt: If the product is to be connected in parallel with other equipment, disable the input termination by setting the DIP switch to the right position (OFF). Failure to do so can impair the image quality. This only applies when using the BNC composite video input.
video_settings_h.term_dipTxt: When connecting the video source, set the termination DIP switches according to the selected connection type:
video_settings_h.subTitle4cTxt2: Connects video IN to video OUT
video_settings_h.help88Txt: When connecting the product in loop-through with other equipment (e.g. to a monitor), disable the input termination by setting DIP switch 1 to the up position (OFF). Failure to do so can impair the image quality. This only applies when using the BNC composite video input.
video_settings_h.help8Txt: When connecting the product in loop-through with other equipment (e.g. to a monitor), disable the input termination by setting DIP switch 1 to the up position (OFF). Failure to do so can impair the image quality. This only applies when using the BNC composite video input. Loop-through is not possible when using the Y/C connection.
video_settings_h.help9Txt1: Offset Adjustments - Entering values in these fields changes the horizontal and vertical synchronization for the image. This can be used to eliminate any black border surrounding the image.
video_settings_h.help9Txt2: Be careful when using high values, both negative and positive, because they could put the image out of sync.
video_settings_h.helpDeinterlaceTxt: De-interlacing - is used to improve video stream image quality from analog devices.
video_settings_h.helpTeleplugTxt1: Select any of the following options from the De-interlacing drop-down list.
video_settings_h.helpTeleplugTxt3: Blending - For improved image quality that is not as processor intensive.
video_settings_h.helpTeleplugTxt4: Adaptive Interpolation - Performs de-interlacing of the video stream by applying different filters on the image. This may give a better result than Motion Adaptive Interpolation in rare cases.
video_settings_h.helpTeleplugTxt5: Motion Adaptive Interpolation - Performs de-interlacing of the video stream by applying different filters depending on the motion in different parts of the image. This will in most cases result in the best image quality.
video_settings_h.help10Txt4: DIP Switches - Each video output is supplied with a corresponding line termination switch, which is enabled by default, i.e. the DIP switch is set in the down position.
video_settings_h.help10Txt5: If the product is to be connected in parallel with other equipment, disable the input termination for the video output by setting the corresponding DIP switch to the up position (OFF). Failure to do so can impair the image quality.
video_settings_h.antialTxt: Antialiasing - This will minimize distortion known as aliasing, which is when a high-resolution image is represented at a lower resolution.
video_settings_h.vidTerTxt: Video termination - If the product is to be connected in parallel with other equipment, disable the video termination by checking this box. Failure to do so can impair the image quality.
video_settings_h.noiseReductionTxt: Noise Reduction - The noise reduction filter reduces noise in the image stream by comparing two sequential images and remove any changes that are considered noise. Select On from the Noise Reduction drop-down list to increase the image quality.
video_settings_h.noiseReduction_ARTPEC5Txt: Noise Reduction - The noise reduction filter reduces noise in the image stream by comparing two sequential images and remove any changes that are considered noise. Use the slidebar to adjust the noise reduction level. A higher value produces an image with little noise, but at the expense of more details in the image.

quad_settings_h.help1Txt: The quad stream provided by the Axis product can be configured much as any single video source.
quad_settings_h.help3Txt1: Resolution - Select the resolution to use for the quad stream. The available resolutions are:
quad_settings_h.help3aTxt: Aspect ratio correction - Checking this box improves the appearance of images from analog video sources when displayed on digital screens (i.e. computer monitors.) The pixels comprising the image are rearranged so as to provide a more accurate representation of the image.
quad_settings_h.help4Txt: Compression - Changing the compression level affects total file sizes. Lower compression improves image quality, but generates larger files.
quad_settings_h.help5Txt: Color settings - Select either Color or Black & White. Black & White uses less bandwidth than Color.
quad_settings_h.help6Txt1: Include overlay - This option places an overlay in the quad stream.
quad_settings_h.help6Txt2: Note: The overlay to use must first be selected in Video & Image - Overlay Image.
quad_settings_h.help7Txt: Three other elements can also be included in the quad stream. These elements are all included on one line, which can be placed at the top or bottom of the stream. These elements are:
quad_settings_h.help8Txt: Date - Available in 3 different pre-defined formats. The format is selected in the Date & Time settings in the System Options.
quad_settings_h.help9Txt: Time - Available in 12h or 24h format, with accuracy up to 1/100 seconds. The format is selected in the Date & Time settings in the System Options.
quad_settings_h.help10Txt: Text - Enter your own text in the field provided. Alternatively, this field can be used to display various information types and formats, by entering special format strings, as described in File Naming & Date/Time Formats.
quad_settings_h.help11Txt1: It is also possible to set how the text and/or background are displayed. The options for text are black or white only, whereas the background can also be set as semi-transparent or transparent.
quad_settings_h.help11Txt2: Select placement of the selected items at the top or the bottom of the stream.
quad_settings_h.help12Txt1: Limit video stream time to - This is used to limit the length of time the stream is displayed for. A maximum time can be defined in seconds, minutes or hours.
quad_settings_h.help12Txt2: When the set time has expired, a new stream can be started by refreshing the page in the browser. For unlimited video stream time, set this value to 0.
quad_settings_h.help13Txt1: Limit frame rate to: x fps (frames per second) per viewer - To avoid bandwidth problems on the network, the frame rate allowed to each viewer can be limited to a fixed amount.
quad_settings_h.help13Txt2: Define a maximum number of frames/second available to each viewer. Setting this value to 0 means the frame rate is unlimited.
quad_settings_h.help14Txt1: Limit frame rate to: x fps (frames per second) per viewer - To avoid bandwidth problems on the network, the frame rate allowed to each viewer can be limited to a fixed amount.
quad_settings_h.help14Txt2: Define a maximum number of frames/second available to each viewer. Setting this value to 0 means the frame rate is unlimited.
